p:
The basic reproductive number ( R 0) is a fundamental measure used to quantify the transmission potential of an epidemic
1 . It is defined as the number of infections caused by an index case within a completely susceptible population, i.e., a population in which there is no pre-existing immunity. R 0 is a summary index suggesting both the intrinsic transmissibility of a pathogen and the infrastructure that allows the disease to spread in a given setting. In particular, the value of R 0 is affected by transmission probability, contact rate and duration of infectiousness
2 .
